low: Low water balance makes fish get sick more easily, reduces harvest numbers
Too-low water balance slows fish growth and they don't eat, delaying harvests
Water balance below normal hurts fish breathing, causes death from stress
Too-low balance affects fish egg laying and baby fish numbers, reducing fish crop
Unbalanced water changes chemicals in fish, making fewer eggs hatch
Too-low water balance gives fish stomach problems, cutting growth
Unbalanced water makes hard for fish to build strong bodies, protect skin
Low balance makes fish act strange and stop eating properly
Too-low water balance builds harmful waste and poisons fish, killing many
Unbalanced water kills good germs that help break food for plants
high: High water balance slows fish growth, not tasting good when harvested
Too-high water balance makes important food bits hard for fish to use, affecting skin and bones
Water balance above normal hurts fish breathing parts, hard to get oxygen
Too-high balance stops fish from producing good eggs and baby fish, lowering harvest
High water level locks away important food bits, making fish hungry and weak
Too-high balance allows harmful waste to hurt fish easily, causing deaths
Water extremes make fish lose balance and float strangely
High balance slows fish digestion, don't grow fast from their food
Too-high water grows bad algae that poisons fish, hurts plant health
Unbalanced water reduces good algae needed to feed plants properly
